com.miviclin.droidengine2d.graphics

Class GLDebugger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.miviclin.droidengine2d.graphics.GLDebugger

  • public final class GLDebugger
extends java.lang.Object
    OpenGL debugger.
    Allows getting error messages from OpenGL errors, logging the number of draw calls, etc.
    Author:
    Miguel Vicente Linares

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FLAG_LOG_NUM_DRAW_CALLS 
      static int FLAG_NO_LOGGING

      Checks if any OpenGL erros occurred before calling this method.

      Returns the instance of GLDebugger.

      Returns the number of draw calls registered in the current frame.
      int getNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()
      Returns the number of draw calls registered in the previously rendered frame.
      void incrementNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()
      Increments the number of draw calls registered in the current frame.

      void logNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()
      Logs the number of draw calls registered in the previously rendered frame.
      void passiveCheckGLError()
      Checks if any OpenGL erros occurred before calling this method.
      void resetNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()
      Sets the number of draw calls registered in the previous frame to the number of draw calls registered in the current frame and resets the number of draw calls registered in the current frame.

      Sets logging flags.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GLDebugger getInstance()
        Returns the instance of GLDebugger.
        Returns:
        GLDebugger

      • setLoggingFlags

        public void setLoggingFlags(int flags)
        Sets logging flags. Use FLAG_NO_LOGGING to disable logging.
        Parameters:
        flags - Logging flags.

      • passiveCheckGLError

        public void passiveCheckGLError()
        Checks if any OpenGL erros occurred before calling this method.
        If the debug mode is disabled, this method will not do anything.
        Throws:
        android.opengl.GLException - If an error is detected.
        See Also:
        checkGLError()

      • checkGLError

        public void checkGLError()
        Checks if any OpenGL erros occurred before calling this method.
        If an error is detected, the debug mode will be enabled, so passiveCheckGLError() calls will also check for errors, making it easier to find the error source.
        Throws:
        android.opengl.GLException - If an error is detected.

      • getNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame

        public int getNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()
        Returns the number of draw calls registered in the current frame.
        In order to register a draw call, incrementNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame() should be called after the draw call is executed.
        Also resetNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame() should be called at the end of each frame.
        Returns:
        Number of draw calls registered in the current frame.
        See Also:
        incrementNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), resetNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), getNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()

      • getNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame

        public int getNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()
        Returns the number of draw calls registered in the previously rendered frame.
        Returns:
        Number of draw calls registered in the previously rendered frame.
        See Also:
        getNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), incrementNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), resetNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()

      • incrementNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame

        public void incrementNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()
        Increments the number of draw calls registered in the current frame.
        This method should be called after each draw call in order to register it.
        See Also:
        getNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), resetNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), getNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()

      • resetNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame

        public void resetNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()
        Sets the number of draw calls registered in the previous frame to the number of draw calls registered in the current frame and resets the number of draw calls registered in the current frame.
        This method should be called at the end of each frame.
        See Also:
        getNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), incrementNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame(), getNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()

      • logNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame

        public void logNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()
        Logs the number of draw calls registered in the current frame. If the flag FLAG_LOG_NUM_DRAW_CALLS is disabled, this method does not do anything.
        See Also:
        getNumDrawCallsInCurrentFrame()

      • logNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame

        public void logNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()
        Logs the number of draw calls registered in the previously rendered frame. If the flag FLAG_LOG_NUM_DRAW_CALLS is disabled, this method does not do anything.
        See Also:
        getNumDrawCallsInPreviousFrame()
